image.altText: Nicolle flint in a grey blazer against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Ahead of the federal election, the Liberal candidate for Boothby, Nicolle Flint, reflects on the factors behind her decision to leave — and now return to — politics.

title.children: Can a former incumbent unseat a sitting MP in this marginal SA seat?

image.altText: Two women smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: Labor has selected candidates to "fly the flag" in safe federal Liberal seats Grey and Barker a month before Australians go to the polls.

title.children: Labor names late-starter candidates in 'unwinnable' SA seats

image.altText: A player holding a ball preparing to throw. Two players go head to head on the side

props.synopsis: Adelaide Thunderbirds coach Tania Obst says two key players will be fit to play as the side begins its quest for a record three consecutive national netball league titles.

title.children: Thunderbirds to chase history as Super Netball launches season

image.altText: People walking on a footpath with arches of a 19th century stone building

props.synopsis: The lawyer for an Adelaide councillor elected in a result found to have been affected by "illegal practices" is seeking to have the case reopened — but an opposing lawyer has likened that move to a "Hail Mary pass" in gridiron.

title.children: Councillor's lawyer trying to perform 'Hail Mary pass', court told

image.altText: A sign at the Women's and Children's Hospital in North Adelaide.

props.synopsis: The head of South Australia's Women's and Children's Hospital has ordered a review of the state's gender diversity service, after the clinic did not refer almost two dozen children to a psychiatrist in line with government guidelines.

title.children: Review ordered into SA gender diversity service's compliance with state guidelines

image.altText: An AdelaideMetro bus front is damaged from smashing head first into tree next to a carpark. Firefighters stand next to bus

props.synopsis: A driver has been freed from the wreckage of a bus that hit a tree at the O-Bahn interchange in Adelaide's north-eastern suburbs.

title.children: Driver sustains 'significant injuries' after Adelaide Metro bus crashes into tree

image.altText: Adelaide businessman Solomon Farah wears sunglasses and a suit as he is questioned by journalists on a city street

props.synopsis: An Adelaide businessman accused of sexually assaulting nine women over two decades has been ordered to stand trial, and lost a request to have his home detention bail conditions relaxed.

title.children: Businessman accused of sexual assault loses 'unacceptable' bail relaxation bid

image.altText: Erin Phillips holds the ball in two hands as she prepares to kick the ball in a 2020 AFLW match.

props.synopsis: Dual sport star Erin Phillips won three AFLW Premierships and was a two-time WNBA champion. But her new biography describes the 'terrible' damage inflicted by skinfold tests and the Opals bodysuit uniform.

title.children: 'I hated my body': Erin Phillips opens up on body image issues

image.altText: cracked dry soil surrounded by dry shrub

props.synopsis: The imposition of US import tariffs is the latest in a long series of challenges for SA farmers, who have battled frost and flooding in recent years, and are currently contending with drought.

title.children: Farmers have battled floods, frost and drought — and now US tariffs

image.altText: Matthew Clarke, Chelsea Randall and Erin Phillips hold premiership cup

props.synopsis: Matthew Clarke makes the decision to step down as Adelaide's coach ahead of this year's AFLW season after leading the Crows to two premierships.

title.children: Dual AFLW premiership-winning coach Clarke to step away from Crows

image.altText: Two man sitting next to each other in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Residents and businesses in a Victorian town hit by a major hailstorm six months ago say insurance companies are moving too slow and offering paltry payouts.

title.children: Restaurant owners with $90k hail bill offered $28k by insurer

image.altText: The entrance to a cave above ground

props.synopsis: After trespassers vandalised Koonalda Cave on the Nullarbor Plain a round-the-clock surveillance system was installed to help protect the nationally significant heritage site.

title.children: Cameras installed following vandalism of ancient Indigenous art

image.altText: Koren stands in her vegetable garden, using a watering can to water seedlings in a small raised garden.

props.synopsis: Getting a handle on how and when to water can make all the difference when it comes to having a successful and fruitful garden.

title.children: Working out the best way to water helped me double my garden harvest

image.altText: Back of a woman's head, her hair tied up in a ponytail, in a room with a display cabinet and TV on the wall

props.synopsis: Despite the growing number of adult female prisoners across Australia, advocates say there are few gender-specific support services to help them transition back into the community.

title.children: Women leaving prison are 'falling through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: A pale penguin on a towel

props.synopsis: Little penguin Pearl is so rare she is first of her type seen by an academic who has been studying her species for a decade.

title.children: Rare white penguin found on SA beach in emaciated state

image.altText: A young woman holds a little sausage dog in her arms, she smiles as she looks down at the pup

props.synopsis: In Queensland, more people live outside the capital city than in it. Come on a 3,000km trip into deep Katter country to see what's really behind the regional divide.

title.children: 'Everyone's gonna hate me': What politicians misunderstand about regional Queensland

image.altText: The Darwin port from an aerial view.

props.synopsis: The Chinese-controlled Port of Darwin looks set to return to Australian hands after the Coalition pledged to negotiate a deal and Labor flagged a similar plan.

title.children: Coalition and Labor pledge to return Port of Darwin to 'Australian hands'

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit walks with a group of people through a factory

props.synopsis: Unions have questioned the Coalition's pledge to keep Same Job Same Pay laws after Opposition Leader Peter Dutton promised not to repeal them.

title.children: Unions say Coalition can't be trusted on Same Job Same Pay laws

image.altText: Russell Brand

props.synopsis: British police charge actor and comedian Russell Brand with rape and multiple sex offences after a bombshell 2023 media investigation made numerous claims about the celebrity.

title.children: Russell Brand charged with rape and sexual assault

image.altText: Tony Mokbel smiles while surrounded by police and media

props.synopsis: Tony Mokbel believes he's spent enough time behind bars, and his release on bail is a sign some of Victoria's most senior legal minds agree.

title.children: More legal highs could be on the way for drug trafficker Tony Mokbel

image.altText: A phone app for Australian Super

props.synopsis: Many Australians were anxiously checking their super accounts on Friday, after news broke of suspected cyber attacks on multiple large superannuation funds.

title.children: 'I can't start at zero now': Australians want answers after cyber attack on super

image.altText: Patrick Dangerfield pumps his right fist during a Geelong AFL match.

props.synopsis: Geelong runs out comfortable 39-point winners over Melbourne at Kardina Park, with Patrick Dangerfield starring as the Demons failed to fire in front of goal.

title.children: Scott says Dangerfield shares similar traits to 'best player of all-time'

image.altText: A traffic jam in inner Brisbane

props.synopsis: The prime minister insists his government's vehicle efficiency standards scheme has "strong support" from industry, as car makers consider pulling models from Australia.

title.children: Albanese backs in vehicle emissions standard despite car makers' concerns

image.altText: A man in a green fire suit and white hard hat inspects a burnt tree in a scorched landscape.

props.synopsis: For the first time this Victorian bushfire season, a specialist Indigenous team protected sacred sites from the Grampians and Little Desert blazes, preventing important art and history from turning to ash.

title.children: Racing the flames to save sacred First Nations cultural sites

image.altText: AI security scanning machine outside MCG entrance

props.synopsis: Since a major security breach at Australia's biggest sports ground, questions are being asked about the security screening technology being used — the first of its type in Australia.

title.children: MCG gun breach puts spotlight on security screening tech

image.altText: Matildas players celebrate a goal

props.synopsis: The Matildas have returned to form, beating Asian Confederation rival South Korea 1-0 in their international friendly at the Sydney Football Stadium.

title.children: Matildas satisfied with win over South Korea but still chasing improvement

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a white shirt

props.synopsis: Annouchka de Jong Heybroek has been immersed in an ugly four-year dispute with her neighbours, strata manager and the apartment block's developer over who is responsible for water gushing through her faulty balcony.

title.children: Owner feels like 'financial prisoner' in own home due to strata saga

image.altText: An open carriage door on a Sydney Metro.

props.synopsis: There is no requirement for Sydney Metro staff to travel on every service, and this week's incident won't change that, the transport minister says.

title.children: Another open door incident on Sydney Metro 'not impossible'

image.altText: Two photos next to each other of a woman with shoulder length light brown hair

props.synopsis: Police have discovered unidentified remains near where missing Queensland woman Tayla Spies's vehicle was found on Thursday.

title.children: Police find human remains close to Tayla Spies's car

image.altText: A long line of people, including children, hold silver bowls in a queue

props.synopsis: The UN is investigating 53 alleged attacks launched by Myanmar's military after it called a ceasefire against rebel groups.

title.children: UN accuses Myanmar military of ceasefire breach as fears deepen over quake aid

image.altText: The outside of a white suburban two storey home where upstairs windows are burnt out

props.synopsis: The man, now known only as "Male Victim 1", alleges he was held prisoner by his stepmother for 20 years — weighing just 31kg when rescued.

title.children: A house fire led US police to a man allegedly held captive for decades

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a blue suit, white shirt and red tie holding a booklet showing off his signature to the camera

props.synopsis: Wonder how Trump's new tariffs were calculated? It would be funny if it wasn't so serious.

title.children: Wondering how Trump's new tariffs were calculated? It will shock you

image.altText: A scenic shot shows the sloping hills of Norfolk Island

props.synopsis: Locals on tiny Norfolk Island have been left "scratching their heads" at the prospect of being slugged with tariffs by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: This tiny island has been slugged with Trump's tariffs. Its residents don't know why

image.altText: a submarine ship in the ocean

props.synopsis: Britain's parliamentary inquiry is into the AUKUS partnership amid geopolitical shifts. Should Australia be worried about its $368 billion deal? Here is what we know.

title.children: What the UK's inquiry into $368b AUKUS deal could mean to Australia

image.altText: The Minecraft movie cast look shocked on a bridge, a world of square video-game blocks behind them.

props.synopsis: Minecraft or Dog Man? Looney Tunes or Snow White? This is what to catch — and what to miss — these April school holidays.

title.children: The new Minecraft movie is a Jack Black musical
